title: MAG 140 - The Movement of the Heavens Transcript
text:
avens 
 
19 
 
That would imply it tells me anything useful. But no, I’m stuck knowing how 
your year 8 PE teacher died. 
BASIRA 
Miss Peterson? 
ARCHIVIST 
Pancreatic cancer, if you’re interested. 
BASIRA 
I... wasn’t? 
ARCHIVIST 
No. No, o-o-of course not. 
Alright, so just me and you, then? I don’t suppose you could get some of the 
team that helped you take Rayner down last time? 
BASIRA 
(Sarcastic) Oh yeah, sure. I’ll just drop them a message. You know, we’ve 
actually got a group chat going called “British cops who love to do extrajudicial 
spook killings on foreign soil.” I’ll just see if they’re free Saturday. 
ARCHIVIST 
Yes, yes! Alright, alright. 
You’re sure about this? 
BASIRA 

The Magnus Archives – 140 – The Movement of the Heavens 
 
20 
 
No. But if I’m right, this is the best chance we’re going to get. 
And I can’t do it alone. 
ARCHIVIST 
Okay then. Let’s do it. 
[Tape clicks off.]

licence. 
Today’s episode was written by Jonathan Sims and directed by Alexander J 
Newall. 
It featured: Jonathan Sims as the Archivist and Frank Voss as Basira Hussain.
